reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely surprise when we arrived at this hotel. It has a inner covered cool court yard with a fountain in the centre on the ground floor. Around this impressing atrium and above are the two floors of bedrooms of around 40.
reviews.title: relaxing hotel, wonderful gardens, on meadering tranquil river.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast is good with the chef cooking eggs a la minute.The quality of fruit juice, coffee and bread is however much to be desired.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, gorgeous room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on a Saturday and the fish BBQ that evening around the pool and gardens was excellent.
reviews.title: One of the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the gardens with jumbo cushions at the edge of the river. Very tranquil indeed.
reviews.title: A little piece of paradise.

likes.liked: — everything was good,no single thing stands out
likes.disliked: — Nothing bad to say at all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was a bit to cold for my wife but I enjoyed it to cool off in 28 Celcius.
reviews.title: An Authentic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: from the moment we checked in to checkout, the service was faultless. Position is perfect, between main town and local fish restraunts. All staff attentive, fun and ensured an enjoyable stay for all. Being a small hotel, we met several lovely pople and enjoyed several nice meals and drinks in the bar.
reviews.title: fabulous, unbeatable value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The downsides (only a few), the town beach was uninviting so we spent most days beside the hotel pool. Our room was adequate, excellant bathroom, comfortable bed but usual lumpy pillows. No balcony to sit on in standard rooms.
reviews.title: Relax in a delightful Boutique Hotel in a quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel food all excellant, breakfast, lunch and dinners unbeatable value.
reviews.title: Excellent venue to get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would reccommend the hotel's breakfast crusie for a relaxing trip along the river and breakfast prepared personally by Nail.
reviews.title: Exactly what it says on the tin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a great taste of nature, visit the (Cenet??) 3rd fish restraunt to the right of the hotel where wild boar visit each night for a snack,and swim up to the tables!!!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This delightful building has been contrcuted in recent years in the extravagant and very distinctive Ottoman styles. Great attention has been paid to the detail, and the finished product gives the impression of many skilled craftsman having been at work.
reviews.title: Opulent luxury in tranquil riverside setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a relatively small hotel, and adult only, which gives it a select, almost 'clubby' feel. However it is far from cliquey. Indeed one of the many charms is the tradition of gathering in the bar at the end of the day and swapping stories with other guests while the barman, who has delusions of being a Manhattan cocktail waiter, tosses and juggles glasses and bottles.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and lovely resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room faced the River. The Akyak River is only a quiet stream, but set in a glade of euclayptus trees, with a view of distant mountains beyond, it creates a tranquil rural idyll. One trip is a day excursion in a tiny boat, with a canopy to provide a little shade. we didn't try this (it starts at 8am) but it should make a pleasant outing.
reviews.title: Peaceful paradise !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing to do in Akyaka, beyond strolling round, sitting on the beach and sampling the cafes and restaurants. This is its charm. It is still a tiny Turkish village, set at the head of the spectacular Gulf of Gokova. We passed a pleasant afternoon strolling through the nearby campsite and through glades of pine trees to the pebbly Cimir beach. This affords spectacular views up and down the Gulf, which is unspoilt by any unsightly development. Swimming in the crystal clear waters was a delight but plastic shoes are advisable as highly poisonous sea urchins are abundant, and great care must be taken to avoid them.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, good location, but try Yucelen for food & friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Returning to the hotel, one of the great pleasures of our stay were the staff. They are not only efficient, but warm, humorous and smiling. This really enahnced our appreciation of Turkish hospitality, and was achieved effortlessly, in a way which would be impossible in the UK.
reviews.title: Perfect for a relaxing start to a long school holiday.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The previous reviews of this hotel sum it up nicely. I would just add a couple of things which might have changed since the last reviews were written. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis, but others were on half board. On a couple of evenings during our stay we ate at the hotel, which cost approximately 28 Turkish Lira. The meal consisted of soup, mezze, a choice of a couple of main courses, and a selection of desserts, including baklava and fresh fruit. We found the food at the hotel to be excellent.
reviews.title: Very relaxing hotel, excellent service from staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in Akyaka itself most evenings and would recommend a small restaurant called The Red Kitchen for dinner. It is very simple but does excellent mezze.
reviews.title: Royal Treatment, Wonderful Staff, Perfect Paradise...!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found our room to be very well laid out with excellent air conditioning and plenty of space.
reviews.title: Ultimate bliss!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They are all so friendly and make an effort to get to know your names and come and have a chat.
reviews.title: Relaxing & Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely return for another relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: Perfect if your looking for a quiet holiday other wise bit average and we had a few problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week's stay at the Ottoman Residence. Overall this is a lovely little hotel - clean and pretty with a boutique feel about it.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: We booked last minute and only duplex rooms were available with a living area (including shower and wash room downstairs and a mezzanine bed area upstairs. I've got mixed feelings on this...
reviews.title: all and more than we expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Undoubtedly the extra space was very handy and we used the seating area more than we anticipated. However, the air conditioning, although most welcome in the 30 degree heat, did have problems reaching the mezzanine area at night time (our ceiling fan only worked in conjunction with the main light). There is also a motion sensor light at the top of the stairs which would occasionally trigger off at random in the night. I appreciate that it's there for safety so no one falls down the stairs whilst going to the toilet in the middle of the night but it could be very annoying at 4am!!
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel, excellent staff, fantastic setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few fixtures in the room were tired and in need of renovation/replacement (bedroom blind, shower head, ceiling needed plaster retouches from water damage, wonky door lock) However, since it is approaching the end of the season, I guess this can be expected.
reviews.title: Book this hotel if you don't want any screaming kids, super friendly staff and only an hour's transfer from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, these were minor issues and did not significantly detract from our enjoyment of the hotel.
reviews.title: Superb! So relaxing, perfect size and staff were brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A short walk from the beach, set on the River Bank with an array of wildlife in the crystal clear waters. Staff were excellent. Particularly recommend the Barbeque night. Nice little town no harassment to dine or buy anything. Definately not a brits abroad resort lovely!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Ottoman Residence in Akyaka and agree with the previous reports re the quality of this hotel. However, the brochure refers to a few shops locally and that you need to take a torch when walking to and from the town, it looks that the area has progressed since that text was written. Street lighting has been added and there are a lot of shops in the village some 10 minutes walk away. However, the setting of the hotel, the surrounding views and the essence of the “village” has not diminished.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing, Very Charming, Very Enjoyable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The brochure also refers to the hotels architecture and whilst it is in keeping with the local style and it is impressive, the detailing is not richly textured, but enough of the architecture.
reviews.title: If it's quiet you're after, this is it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good, but limited, however, it was perfectly adequate, the lunch menu was also very good, we did not have dinner in the hotel, so cannot comment, but the people that did said the food was very good and varied over the week.
reviews.title: A well run, friendly hotel in a very peaceful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009
reviews.text: The service was impeccable and even if you were down in the garden, the waiters were always alert and ready to respond to you requests.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay in beautiful surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the Ottoman Residence in May 2011 and found the hotel to be very comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a duplex room and for us it worked, giving us a balcony and seperate sitting space downstairs.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from breakfast we did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food. However, we did find a few places to eat that we would strongly recommend. Firstly, the Kordon Fish restuarant - the second fish restaurant as you head towards Akyaka village. Meze was stunning as was the fresh fish. Also the Kristal Pide and Kebab House at the top of the village near the PTT - we love Pide and this certainly was a highlight for us. Finally, try the Organic Olive Cafe which is the opposite direction to the village but does beautiful fresh salad and dont miss the home made cake - lemon cheesecake while we were there!
reviews.title: Still not sure about this hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is definately worth walking to Cinar beach, most of us got lost on our first attempt at getting there, but there is a little cafe on the beach and sunbeds for hire. Also the lady in the PTT was an absolute joy to deal with.
reviews.title: Traditional Turkey in a stunning setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the staff at the Anchor pub in the centre of the village deserve a big thank you for letting my partner watch the League 1 playoff finals even though they had never heard of the teams playing.
reviews.title: scousers week out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am still not really sure about this hotel or the resort of Akyaka. The hotel itself has great facilities, including a decent swimming pool. The level of service provided by the staff was exceptional. The room however (we had a standard room) was very small and I was shocked by the size of the bathroom. The standard rooms do not have a balcony large enough to sit on, so we spent no time relaxing in our room. The water in the bathrooms were chlorinated and the levels seemed to vary everyday - it doesn't do any wonders for your skin and hair!!
reviews.title: tranquil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean and the staff were all very friendly and helpful.The food was good and we enjoyed the breakfast omelettes. However I think we had the worst room in the hotel 110. The balcony was very nearly nonexistent and overlooked the road at the front of the hotel. The bathroom was claustrophobic and not well lit as was the rest of the room. It was quiet around the pool and felt a bit like a Saga holiday would be.
reviews.title: Disappointed with room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just spent 2 weeks staying at the Ottoman Residence.The public areas of this hotel are fantastic, spotlessly clean and very attractive and, the staff are very helpful and friendly. The pool area is very attractive and the lower garden great for chilling out though mosquitoes can be a problem in the evenings.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly the rooms do not live up to the rest of the hotel, we had a ‘deluxe’ room which frankly is a joke. Basically the deluxe rooms which overlook the pool area are duplex rooms which due to the corner location have an unusable upstairs area. Due to the lack of headroom upstairs the have put the bed downstairs and put a sofa and armchair upstairs as a sitting room but you cant sit there as there is only about 2 or 3 feet of headroom above the sofa and chair and who would want to sit there with only a view of the white ceiling and ceiling fan that doesn’t work because you cant reach the switches on the fan as it is 12 feet off the lower floor and unreachable from the upper floor. The shower room though small is adequate, but the room also contains a kitchen sink and worktop complete with cooker hood extractor fan but no cooking facility. The upstairs is good only for storing suitcases, the bed being downstairs means that you cannot open the windows without moving the bed out from in front of the windows so that they can clear the headboard. In this configuration there is only space for one bedside table and lamp so only one can read at night. Also the hotel brochure states that the deluxe rooms have a Jacuzzi this is apparently a misprint as they certainly don’t.
reviews.title: all chilled out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several other guests were complaining about their rooms mainly the duplexes so a standard room though small is probably best.
reviews.title: Enjoyable week in the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is quite good but surely a hotel surrounded by citrus groves should serve fresh pressed juice at breakfast and not the synthetic toxic green, day glow orange or shocking pink concoction that is on offer.
reviews.title: A great place to stay and unwind
